Label: Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, Low Frequency Waveform Receiver, ~0.01 sec resolution fields - D. Gurnett (U. Iowa)

VariableDescription.Name: DATA_QUALITY
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           POLAR PWI LFWR
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     POLAR>Polar Plasma Laboratory
#     DATA_TYPE                       H2>LFWR
#     DESCRIPTOR                      PWI>Plasma Wave Instrument
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            Reference:..Gurnett, D.A. et al, The Polar plasma wave instrument, Space Science                       
#                                      Reviews, Vol. 71, pp. 597-622, 1995.GURNETT@IOWAVE.physics.uiowa.edu                                  
#                                     An FFT on 256 or 464 values, depending on the snapshot size, was used in calibrating                   
#                                      the data; i.e., perform FFT, calibrate in frequency domain, perform inverse                           
#                                      FFT to get calibrated time series.                                                                    
#                                     Coordinate System Used:  local magnetic field-aligned, a spacecraft centered                           
#                                      coordinate system where Z is parallel to the local B-field determined from                            
#                                      Polar MFE, X points outward and lies in the plane defined by the Z-axis and                           
#                                      the radial vector from the earth to the spacecraft, and Y completes a right-handed                    
#                                      system and points eastward.  The X- and Z-axes are contained in the north-south                       
#                                      plane.                                                                                                
#                                     The three orthogonal magnetic field components are given in units of nT/Sec                            
#                                      rather than nT because the response of the searchcoils across the passband                            
#                                      is not flat.  In order to obtain units of nT, the data would need to be digitally                     
#                                      filtered to the frequency of interest and then integrated over time.  Integrating                     
#                                      over the entire passband could possibly destroy the resolution of the higher                          
#                                      frequency components since the low frequency noise, if present, will dominate.                        
#                                     Data are bandpass filtered.  The valid range of data in the frequency domain                           
#                                      is from 0.5 to 22.5 Hz.                                                                               
#     MODS                            Created Oct 1999
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0171
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 po_h2_pwi_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  po_h2_pwi
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, Low Frequency Waveform Receiver, ~0.01 sec resolution                    
#                                      fields                                                                                                
#     PI_NAME                         D. Gurnett
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  U. Iowa
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Polar
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)
#     LINK_TEXT                       Notes on
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 0.01 seconds
#     LINK_TITLE                      H2_PWI coordinates and computation
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/cdaweb/misc/NotesP.html#PO_H2_PWI
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Polar_PWI_lowfreq_h2_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. Data Quality 0 = OK, 1 = poor
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:47:39 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Data Quality 0 = OK, 1 = poor
#
EPOCH                    DATA_QUALITY
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms  (0=OK,1=poor)
25-03-1996 00:00:16.888             0

VariableDescription.Name: LFWR_Ex
VariableDescription.LongDescription: LFWR Elec. Field, Antenna Ex (perp & outward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)

#                                      the data; i.e., perform FFT, calibrate in frequency domain, perform inverse

#                                      Polar MFE, X points outward and lies in the plane defined by the Z-axis and                           
#                                      the radial vector from the earth to the spacecraft, and Y completes a right-handed                    
#                                      system and points eastward.  The X- and Z-axes are contained in the north-south                       
#                                      plane.                                                                                                
#                                     The three orthogonal magnetic field components are given in units of nT/Sec                            
#                                      rather than nT because the response of the searchcoils across the passband                            
#                                      is not flat.  In order to obtain units of nT, the data would need to be digitally                     
#                                      filtered to the frequency of interest and then integrated over time.  Integrating                     
#                                      over the entire passband could possibly destroy the resolution of the higher                          
#                                      frequency components since the low frequency noise, if present, will dominate.                        
#                                     Data are bandpass filtered.  The valid range of data in the frequency domain                           
#                                      is from 0.5 to 22.5 Hz.                                                                               
#     MODS                            Created Oct 1999
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0171
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 po_h2_pwi_00000000_v01

#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Polar Plasma Wave Instrument, Low Frequency Waveform Receiver, ~0.01 sec resolution

#     PI_AFFILIATION                  U. Iowa

#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Radio and Plasma Waves (space)

#     LINK_TITLE                      H2_PWI coordinates and computation
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/cdaweb/misc/NotesP.html#PO_H2_PWI

#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time
#  2. LFWR Elec. Field, Antenna Ex (perp & outward in Local-Field-Aligned/LFA coords)
#       NOTES:  When FFT is applied, Filter Rolls off at 25 kHz
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:47:40 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#       NOTES:  When FFT is applied, Filter Rolls off at 25 kHz
#
EPOCH                     LFWR_EX-LFA
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms           mV/M
25-03-1996 00:00:16.888      0.590155
